articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Northwest Detention Center operator sues Tacoma over land
articles.description: Group that runs federal detention center sues Tacoma for restricting access to land to possibly expand the facility.

articles.author: Kenny Ocker
articles.title: 10 arrested outside Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma
articles.description: About 160 people had gathered in front of the detention center to protest immigration-enforcement policies.

articles.author: Kenny Ocker
articles.title: 10 arrested outside Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma
articles.description: About 160 people had gathered in front of the detention center to protest immigration-enforcement policies.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 2nd lawsuit says Tacoma detention center must pay minimum wage
articles.description: Former detainee Chao Chen filed the class-action federal lawsuit Tuesday against The GEO Group, the for-profit company that operates the Northwest Detention Center.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Judge allows Washington state’s lawsuit over detainee pay to proceed
articles.description: The judge on Wednesday denied a motion to dismiss the case, filed by the GEO Group, a for-profit company that runs the Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma.

articles.author: Rabbi Zari M. Weiss
articles.title: In an ancient story of exile, finding common ground with immigrants facing deportation
articles.description: While holding seder outside the Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma, Rabbi Zari M. Weiss found parallels between the suffering of her forebears and immigrants under the Trump administration.

articles.author: Jim Brunner
articles.title: Sen. Patty Murray received donations from private immigration prison firms
articles.description: U.S. Sen. Patty Murray has condemned conditions in privately run immigration detention centers. But she's received the largest amount of campaign cash from private prison operators, including the company running the Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: ‘This never happens’: International student’s unexpected ordeal ends with surprise twist
articles.description: An international student is held for weeks at the Northwest Detention Center, unable even to return to her home country. Then came a surprising turn of events. “This never happens,” her attorney said.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Judge lowers bond for immigrant tracked down by ICE after speaking to media
articles.description: A Pacific County man was arrested by immigration officials after an interview with The Seattle Times. He has been held at the Northwest Detention Center for more than a month.

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.title: Immigrant targeted for deportation came to ICE’s attention after protests and newspaper interview, document shows
articles.description: Maru Mora-Villalpando, 47, supports immigrants detained at the privately run Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma. U.N. human-rights experts have called on the U.S. to protect Mora-Villalpando from deportation.

articles.author: Seattle Times editorial board
articles.title: Private immigration detention center must follow state laws
articles.description: The corporation running a for-profit immigration detention center in Tacoma is exploiting workers by not paying them the state minimum wage.

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.title: GEO Group wants lawsuits tossed over paying higher wages to immigrants held at Northwest Detention Center
articles.description: For-profit company GEO pays detainees $1 a day at the Tacoma facility — one of the nation’s largest privately run immigration-detention centers — for janitorial, laundry and kitchen work. Washington’s minimum wage is $11 per hour.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: State AG Bob Ferguson files lawsuit against company that operates Northwest Detention Center
articles.description: “One dollar a day. Give me a break,” said State Attorney General Bob Ferguson, who filed suit against the country’s fourth-largest detention center, in Tacoma. That’s the amount detainees are paid to work — a violation of the state’s minimum-wage law, Ferguso…

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: State AG Bob Ferguson files lawsuit against company that operates Northwest Detention Center
articles.description: “One dollar a day. Give me a break,” said State Attorney General Bob Ferguson, who filed suit against the country’s fourth-largest detention center, in Tacoma. That’s the amount detainees are paid to work — a violation of the state’s minimum-wage law, Ferguso…

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: State AG Bob Ferguson files lawsuit against company that operates Northwest Detention Center
articles.description: “One dollar a day. Give me a break,” said State Attorney General Bob Ferguson, who filed suit against the country’s fourth-largest detention center, in Tacoma. That’s the amount detainees are paid to work — a violation of the state’s minimum-wage law, Ferguso…

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.title: Lawsuit: Immigrant beaten for role in hunger strike at Tacoma detention center
articles.description: The inmate, Jesus Chavez Flores, is one of more than 120 immigrant detainees who began a hunger strike Feb. 7 to protest the quality of the food they're served and the $1 per day they're paid to perform janitorial, kitchen, laundry or other work at the Northw…

articles.author: CANDICE RUUD
articles.title: Is the issue land use or Trump’s politics? Northwest Detention Center sues Tacoma over move to restrict expansion
articles.description: The lawsuit claims Tacoma has tried to keep the detention center from expanding because the City Council objects to President Donald Trump’s aggressive immigration policies. A deputy city attorney says the city is just trying to protect valuable land in the P…

articles.author: Letters editor
articles.title: Immigration courts: ‘Heartbreaking’
articles.description: Nina Shapiro’s piece on immigration courts was accurate and important. I attended a deportation hearing for the father of my daughter’s friend at the Northwest Detention Center in Tacoma last year. It was sobering and heartbreaking. The building is buried in …

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Hearing set for Pacific County immigrant ICE arrested after Seattle Times interview
articles.description: A Pacific County immigrant arrested by immigration officials after talking to The Seattle Times now has a lawyer and a bond hearing scheduled, but will likely stay at the detention center for a month.

articles.author: Kirsten O'Brien
articles.title: Demonstrators block traffic on Second Avenue in downtown Seattle
articles.description: A small group of demonstrators blocked traffic on Second Avenue and Marion Street in downtown Seattle Tuesday morning. A demonstration is blocking 2nd Ave at Madison St. Use alternate routes. The bike lane appears usable for those on bikes. pic.twitter.com/Tt…

articles.author: Kirsten O'Brien
articles.title: Demonstrators block traffic on Second Avenue in downtown Seattle
articles.description: A small group of demonstrators blocked traffic at Second Avenue and Marion Street in downtown Seattle on Tuesday morning. A demonstration is blocking 2nd Ave at Madison St. Use alternate routes. The bike lane appears usable for those on bikes. pic.twitter.com…

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Northwest immigrant-rights official awaiting specifics after Trump announcement
articles.description: “The administration did this without thinking, and now they’re probably not thinking, either,” says Jorge Barón, executive director of the Northwest Immigrant Rights Project.

articles.author: Lewis Kamb
articles.title: AG Ferguson: Washington, other states to sue Trump administration over ‘zero tolerance’ immigration policy
articles.description: The lawsuit will be filed “imminently” and will challenge the executive order signed by President Donald Trump on Wednesday, Attorney General Bob Ferguson said in front of the Federal Detention Center in SeaTac.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Police arrest 6 suspects in crime spree in Las Vegas area
articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — Police in Las Vegas say they have arrested six suspects in connection with 14 crimes. Police on Wednesday said the crimes took place Jan. 15-23 in the northwest Las Vegas valley. They included robberies, home invasions, kidnappings, carjackin…

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Police probe central Indiana shooting that killed boy, 17
articles.description: LEBANON, Ind. (AP) — Suburban Indianapolis police are holding a 16-year-old in the fatal shooting of a 17-year-old boy. Lebanon police says the boy was pronounced dead Monday at a muffler shop in the city about 20 miles northwest of Indianapolis. Police say t…

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Immigration advocates try to determine how many detainees at SeaTac prison are separated from children
articles.description: “Chaos” is how an immigrant advocate describes trying to learn more about roughly 200 people sent to a SeaTac Federal Detention Center by immigration authorities. Still unknown: Exactly how many of those at the prison were separated from their children.

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.title: U.N. experts: Seattle-area activist’s deportation proceedings appear to be retaliation
articles.description: The U.N. Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights said in a statement that deportation proceedings against Seattle-area activist Maru Mora-Villalpando appeared to be in retaliation for her political work.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 2 suspects arrested in shooting of Wichita Menards employee
articles.description: WICHITA, Kan. (AP) — Both suspects in the shooting of a loss prevention officer at a Wichita Menards store are in custody. Police spokesman Charley Davidson said an 18-year-old male was arrested Wednesday in Hays. Details of the arrest were not immediately re…

articles.author: Jessica Lee
articles.title: Immigrants-rights activists say up to 120 asylum seekers — separated from children — being held at SeaTac prison
articles.description: Gov. Jay Inslee and Attorney General Bob Ferguson said they have "serious concerns" about the treatment of the people now here seeking asylum in the U.S., who activists say were transferred from Texas after crossing the border at Mexico.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Activist Maru Mora-Villalpando says ICE using her deportation as ‘intimidation tactic’
articles.description: Activist Maru Mora-Villalpando, an undocumented immigrant, says federal immigration officials are using an “intimidation tactic” by putting her into deportation proceedings.

articles.author: Christine Clarridge
articles.title: Slaying the ‘sleeping dragon’: Seattle police change tactics to counter traffic-blocking protesters
articles.description: In March, opponents of King County’s new juvenile detention center were able to bring Friday traffic to a grinding halt for about six hours and shed light on their cause by simply laying down in the middle of a downtown Seattle intersection. They resisted eas…

articles.author: SHANE DIXON KAVANAUGH
articles.title: Student says federal agents treated her like criminal
articles.description: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — She arrived at Portland International Airport on a warm summer evening, dreaming of craft beer, long hikes and the good company she was about to enjoy in the Pacific Northwest. Instead, Cristina Alonso, a 22-year-old student from Spain, …

articles.author: Steve Miletich
articles.title: No retaliation against immigrant who spoke to media, ICE director tells Inslee
articles.description: Gov. Jay Inslee said that, during a phone conversation Thursday, acting ICE director Thomas Homan assured him that Baltazar “Rosas” Aburto Gutierrez was not detained for talking publicly about his girlfriend’s arrest by immigration agents.

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.title: In Seattle courtroom, immigrant activist seeks end to deportation effort
articles.description: A Mexico City native who overstayed a visa issued in 1996, Maru Mora-Villalpando says she is being targeted because of her activism.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: ICE tracks down immigrant who spoke to media in SW Washington: ‘You are the one from the newspaper’
articles.description: After talking to The Seattle Times about his girlfriend’s arrest by immigration officials, a Pacific County man was detained himself. He said an agent told him it was because of what had been written.

articles.author: Sandi Doughton
articles.title: ‘Heartbreaking’: Pramila Jayapal meets the 168 asylum-seeking women, many separated from their children, held at SeaTac prison
articles.description: Washington state officials Saturday continued their condemnation of the Trump administration policy of separating children from their parents at the southwest border. Attorney General Bob Ferguson left open the possibility of suing the government.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: As Trump orders judges to hurry up, look inside immigration court’s ‘alternate legal universe’
articles.description: The Trump administration is putting pressure on immigration courts to work faster. Judges, alarmed about the consequences for due process, want independence. The stakes are high, yet this “alternate legal universe” is largely out of public view.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: As Trump orders judges to hurry up, look inside immigration court’s ‘alternate legal universe’
articles.description: The Trump administration is putting pressure on immigration courts to work faster. Judges, alarmed about the consequences for due process, want independence. The stakes are high, yet this “alternate legal universe” is largely out of public view.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Tukwila officers turn immigrant over to ICE. Was that legal?
articles.description: A Honduran immigrant calls the police when someone breaks into his car, and gets arrested himself when Tukwila officers see a warrant from immigration authorities. Now, everybody’s trying to figure out what happened — and whether it was legal.

articles.author: SELENA ROSS
articles.title: Canadian government is putting asylum seekers to work
articles.description: MONTREAL — In a darkened room at a suburban community center last month, a representative from a Canadian meatpacking company showed a huge map on the screen. More than 30 Haitians who had recently walked across the border to file refugee claims in Canada wer…

articles.author: Morning Brief
articles.title: Get lost in Seattle’s map of ‘high weirdness,’ Supreme Court deals blow to labor unions | Wednesday Morning Brief, June 27
articles.description: Morning Brief is a newsletter from The Seattle Times delivered straight to your inbox every morning, Monday through Friday. Our editors choose the morning’s most important and entertaining items, and deliver them to you in short, easy-to-digest bites.

articles.author: Morning Brief
articles.title: Get lost in Seattle’s map of ‘high weirdness,’ Supreme Court deals blow to labor unions | Wednesday Morning Brief, June 27
articles.description: Morning Brief is a newsletter from The Seattle Times delivered straight to your inbox every morning, Monday through Friday. Our editors choose the morning’s most important and entertaining items, and deliver them to you in short, easy-to-digest bites.

articles.author: Amy B Wang
articles.title: A jogger accidentally crossed into the US from Canada and was detained for two weeks
articles.description: The coast of White Rock, British Columbia, in western Canada looks to be an ideal place for a run, with its sweeping views of the Semiahmoo Bay to the west and scores of waterfront homes and seafood restaurants to the east. That’s what 19-year-old Cedella Rom…

articles.author: Elizabeth Dawson-Hahn
articles.title: Separating families is a humanitarian and health crisis
articles.description: Families seeking asylum at the U.S. border are fleeing violence, torture or persecution, and flight itself presents additional risk of violence, sexual assault and hunger — all with no guarantee of a sympathetic reception.

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Immigrant held in SeaTac prison hasn’t seen her child since May: ‘I haven’t heard my son’s voice’
articles.description: A 25-year-old mother from Honduras was separated from her son in accordance with President Donald Trump’s “zero-tolerance” policy toward immigrants who cross the border illegally. She is now being held at a SeaTac prison. Children, she said, “need the warmth …

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.title: Washington state judge declines to release Iraq vet as he fights deportation
articles.description: Chong Kim, a South Korean immigrant and green-card holder from Portland, Ore., struggled with drug addition, homelessness and post-traumatic stress following his time in Iraq in 2009 and 2010, leading to convictions for burglary and other charges.

articles.author: Kate Riley
articles.title: Inspirational immigrant stories remind us Trump is wrong
articles.description: The immigrants that President Donald Trump would deny entry have stories not so different from the stories of immigrants throughout American history.

articles.author: MUNIR AHMED and JILL COLVIN, ROB GILLIES
articles.title: Kidnapped, held 5 years, US-Canadian family free in Pakistan
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Five years after they were seized by a terrorist network in the mountains of Afghanistan, an American woman, her Canadian husband and their children — all three born in captivity — are free after a dramatic rescue orchestrated by the U.S. an…

articles.author: Matt Pentz
articles.title: Isolation to inclusion: the evolution of the Korean Women舗s Association
articles.description: As it nears its 45th anniversary, Tacoma’s Korean Women’s Association has grown into a wide-reaching provider of social services.

articles.author: PAUL GUZZO
articles.title: In Cold War Cuba, failed rescue delivered high adventure
articles.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — Lee Davis entertains visitors from his bed these days, facing the final stages of prostate cancer, congestive heart failure and a move to hospice in the coming weeks. But first, the one-time commodore of the Davis Islands Yacht Club, whose …

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Washington state regularly gives drivers’ info to immigration authorities; Inslee orders temporary halt
articles.description: Despite vowing not to cooperate with President Trump’s immigration agenda, Washington state has regularly been giving out personal information used by ICE to arrest and deport people. After The Seattle Times raised questions, the governor told an agency to st…

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: Washington state regularly gives drivers’ info to immigration authorities; Inslee orders temporary halt
articles.description: Despite vowing not to cooperate with President Trump’s immigration agenda, Washington state has regularly been giving out personal information used by ICE to arrest and deport people. After The Seattle Times raised questions, the governor told an agency to st…

articles.author: Nina Shapiro
articles.title: A Washington county that went for Trump is shaken as immigrant neighbors start disappearing
articles.description: Many in Pacific County thought President Trump would take away “drug dealers, criminals, rapists” with his immigration crackdown. They were shocked to see who started to go missing.

articles.author: Ron Judd
articles.title: 2017 Pictures of the Year
articles.description: In the sky, on the streets, in our hearts: an uneasy mix of darkness and light.
